page.title: 07Ecology of Mark
page.content: Although Mark is one of the most peaceful villages on the western side of Somerset,it is also buzzing - buzzing with the life of many different{wild species.}It has an army of birds of which perhaps the most graceful are the swan and heron. Many different species of{birds}are to be seen - swallows,house martins,thrushes and various{preying birds}hovering or stalking their prey.On the Somerset Levels,breeding grounds are protected. {Foxes}are also inhabitants of Mark. Many a poultry farmer must be bothered by those sly red preditors. There are many rhines and ponds which are the dwellings of thousands of {animals,insects and fish.}Looking for small amphibians is every small boy's delight and a good murky pond is just the place to find{frogs,toads and {newts. }
